title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no children node listing. Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page. 3. Change the data source to a new one that does not have any database/table/column information. Actual result: The children node listing is not displayed. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
EB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing should be displayed properly.
SR: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page. 3. Change the data source to a new one that does not have any database/table/column information. Expected result: The children node listing should be displayed properly. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
